info.title: About the TDEE Calculator
info.description: Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) represents the total number of calories your body burns in a day, including your basal metabolic rate (BMR) and calories burned through physical activity. This calculator uses the Mifflin-St Jeor equation to calculate your BMR and multiplies it by your activity level.
info.mifflinFormula:
Men: BMR = 10 × weight(kg) + 6.25 × height(cm) - 5 × age + 5
Women: BMR = 10 × weight(kg) + 6.25 × height(cm) - 5 × age - 161
TDEE = BMR × Activity Factor
info.sedentaryDesc: Little or no exercise, desk job
info.activeDesc: Daily exercise or intense exercise 3-4 times per week
info.extraActiveDesc: Very intense daily exercise plus physical job or training twice per day
info.limitations: These estimates are general guidelines. Individual energy needs may vary based on metabolism, body composition, genetics, and other health factors. Consult with a healthcare professional or nutritionist for a personalized plan.
